summary: In the summer of 2020, the Department of Health and Human Services began a $265 million campaign to promote COVID-19 prevention and encourage vaccine acceptance. HHS made awards to two consulting firms for this effort. Congressional committees raised concerns that CDC funding was used for this campaign, and also questioned its timing given the upcoming election. HHS then reviewed the awards and terminated one. This...
title: COVID-19: Information on HHS's Public Education Campaign
